newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy offers 11.0 trln lire bonds, certificates.
newsitem.headline: Italy offers 11.0 trln lire bonds, certificates.

text.p: The Italian Treasury said it will issue a total of 11.0 trillion lire of medium to long-term paper for sale at its regular mid-month auction.
The Treasury said in a statement said it would offer:
* 3.5 trillion lire of three-year fixed rate bonds (BTP) paying a 6.0 percent coupon.
* 2.5 trillion lire of five-year 6.25 percent BTPs
* 3.0 trillion lire of 7-year floating rate certificates (CCTs) paying a first coupon of 3.45 percent.
Subscriptions for the CCT and 10-year BTP auctions close at 1200 GMT on January 15.
Subscriptions for the three and five year BTP auctions close at 1200 GMT on January 16.
